transportAdvice: Kelowna has a local bus network that covers major areas including downtown and some tourist zones, though service frequency can be limited and a car is often more practical for reaching wineries, beaches, and surrounding attractions. Taxis and ride-hailing options are available, and the compact downtown waterfront area is walkable.

weather.description: Cold winter month with occasional snow and overcast skies; outdoor activities are limited.
Still cold with some snow possible, but days begin to lengthen slightly.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and a mix of sun and rain.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming orchards and increasing sunshine.
Warm and mostly sunny with occasional showers; a great time to explore the valley.
Early summer brings warm, dry days ideal for beaches and outdoor dining.
Hot and sunny peak summer month; Okanagan Lake beaches are busy and inviting.
Continued hot and dry weather with harvest season beginning in the vineyards.
Warm and golden autumn days with wine harvest in full swing; excellent for winery visits.
Cooler temperatures and increasing cloud cover signal the end of the tourist season.
Cool and often grey with rain or early snow possible; quieter and slower-paced.
Cold winter month with short days and possible snow; festive atmosphere in town.
